## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 601050353.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz -int 187465780 187465780 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 699 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1504 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 3643 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2230 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1504 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1413 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region

 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1505 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1412 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------

        reference diplotypes: 133 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 3 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [187465780,187465780]
                      buffer: 250 kb

diploid sampling success rate: 0.994

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 561115450.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz -int 5030822 5030822 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------

--------------

             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output_info_by_sample

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 701925117.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz -int 59257464 59257464 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --read 811 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1557 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 3002 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

 --removed 1659 SNPs

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1557 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1343 SNPs with data in multiple panels

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 568173373.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz -int 85189259 85189259 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_warnings

-----------------

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/input.gen.gz -int 225293450 225293450 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0041/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1671796670.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz -int 162546619 162546619 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_warnings

-----------------

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 464218412.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz -int 63769835 63769835 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 926 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 2911 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2055 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 926 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 856 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1571236359.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/input.gen.gz -int 89923789 89923789 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 575 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1351 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0059/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 3601 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2309 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1351 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1292 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 905853988.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz -int 70429927 70429927 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0063/output_summary

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 929056318.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz -int 115874566 115874566 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --read 1384 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 131 individuals
 --read 3256 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 257628099.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/input.gen.gz -int 88852932 88852932 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file

 --read 675 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1708 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 4017 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1708 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1641 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz -int 41362974 41362974 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_warnings

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file

 --read 3819 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 174288565.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/input.gen.gz -int 105329107 105329107 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0113/output_warnings

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 844858048.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/input.gen.gz -int 314890 314890 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_warnings

-----------------

 --read 303 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read 3615 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 378898973.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/input.gen.gz -int 71940748 71940748 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 732 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1334 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0147/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 2422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1333 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1334 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1089 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]

-setting storage space

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 780565233.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz -int 44059478 44059478 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0174/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 25563420.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/input.gen.gz -int 75419740 75419740 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0191/output_warnings

-----------------

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).
