======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1282365188.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz -int 147553909 147553909 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 797 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1580 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0201/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 3814 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2264 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1580 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1550 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0212/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0212/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0212/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0212/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0212/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0212/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0212/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1695327977.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz -int 241626867 241626867 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 392 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1583 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0241/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 131 individuals
 --read 3820 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2392 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1583 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1428 SNPs with data in multiple panels

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 147397719.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/input.gen.gz -int 188873632 188873632 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1928 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region
 --excluded 1 SNPs, leaving 1927 SNPs for analysis
   --1 SNPs excluded for having no data

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 132 individuals
 --read 4810 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 3053 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1927 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1757 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --710 type 2 SNPs
 --56 type 3 SNPs
 --766 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --1046 type 2 SNPs
 --115 type 3 SNPs
 --1161 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1928 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1756 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 132 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 3 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [188873632,188873632]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 264 [Panel 1->2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

1 warning was generated during this run. See the warnings file [tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0266/output_warnings] for details.

Have a nice day!

 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1920688789.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/input.gen.gz -int 142203656 142203656 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 537 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1255 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0284/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 132 individuals
 --read 3706 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2502 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1255 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1204 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1257705368.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz -int 37392204 37392204 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0325/output_warnings

diploid sampling success rate: 0.997

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0

  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2036490951.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/input.gen.gz -int 80405572 80405572 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr13_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0341/output_warnings

-----------------

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1167238643.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/input.gen.gz -int 61075607 61075607 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0347/output_warnings

-----------------

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0370sd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0370sd/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0370sd/output_info_by_sample

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1972670806.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/input.gen.gz -int 28950753 28950753 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0374/output_warnings

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 210447756.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz -int 25909500 25909500 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr20_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0382/output_warnings

-----------------

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 612760819.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz -int 48921073 48921073 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 564 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1581 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0486/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 48 individuals
 --read 3300 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1852 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1581 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1448 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-In total, 1582 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1447 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

        reference diplotypes: 48 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 3 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [48921073,48921073]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1525871434.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/input.gen.gz -int 28568862 28568862 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0786/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 802775243.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/input.gen.gz -int 195981908 195981908 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0965/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1415470711.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/input.gen.gz -int 29069369 29069369 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0991/output_warnings

-----------------

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/input.gen.gz -int 47299663 47299663 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 614 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1299 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1066/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 58 individuals
 --read 2672 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1529 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1299 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1143 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

ERROR: There are no type 2 SNPs after applying the command-line settings for this run, which makes it impossible to perform imputation. One possible reason is that you have specified an analysis interval (-int) that contains reference panel SNPs but not inference panel SNPs -- e.g., this can happen at the ends of chromosomes. Another possibility is that your genotypes and the reference panel are mapped to different genome builds, which can lead the same SNPs to be assigned different positions in different panels. If you need help fixing this error, please contact the authors.

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1075sd/reference.gen.gz

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/input.gen.gz -int 15390928 15390928 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1110/output_warnings

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
