--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1024132425.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/input.gen.gz -int 25613115 25613115 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1128/output_warnings

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 234205300.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/input.gen.gz -int 48941109 48941109 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 538 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1067 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1143/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 1956 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

 --removed 1059 SNPs

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1067 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 897 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 756741687.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/input.gen.gz -int 39860174 39860174 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 309 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 879 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1256/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 1640 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 961 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 879 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 679 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]

-setting storage space

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 528336877.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/input.gen.gz -int 65842837 65842837 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1321/output_warnings

MCMC iteration [30/30]


diploid sampling success rate: 0.984

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 586432332.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/input.gen.gz -int 5595133 5595133 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --read 799 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1875 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1358/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 3154 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1887999440.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/input.gen.gz -int 8259136 8259136 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 977 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1902 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1569/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 3133 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1523 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1902 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1610 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]

-setting storage space

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

 --excluded 1 SNPs, leaving 1047 SNPs for analysis
   --1 SNPs excluded for having no data

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

1 warning was generated during this run. See the warnings file [tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1798/output_warnings] for details.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1502325718.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1838/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1838/input.gen.gz -int 47654312 47654312 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1838/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1838/reference.gen.gz

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/input.gen.gz -int 30954417 30954417 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv1878/output_info_by_sample
